info.title: Akash Network Console API
info.description: API providing data to the Akash Network Console

post.summary: Start a trial period for a user
post.description: Creates a managed wallet for a user and initiates a trial period. This endpoint handles payment method validation and may require 3D Secure authentication for certain payment methods. Returns wallet information and trial status.

200.description: Trial started successfully and wallet created

202.description: 3D Secure authentication required to complete trial setup

get.description: Retrieves the wallet settings for the current user's wallet

post.description: Creates wallet settings for a user wallet

put.description: Updates wallet settings for a user wallet

delete.description: Deletes wallet settings for a user wallet

post.summary: Signs a transaction via a user managed wallet

get.summary: Creates a stripe checkout session and redirects to checkout

get.description: Retrieves the list of available pricing options for wallet top-ups, including custom amounts and standard pricing tiers

post.summary: Apply a coupon to the current user

put.description: Updates the organization/business name for the current user's Stripe customer account

post.summary: Create a Stripe SetupIntent for adding a payment method
post.description: Creates a Stripe SetupIntent that allows users to securely add payment methods to their account. The SetupIntent provides a client secret that can be used with Stripe's frontend SDKs to collect payment method details.

200.description: SetupIntent created successfully with client secret

post.summary: Marks a payment method as the default.

200.description: Payment method is marked as the default successfully.

get.summary: Get the default payment method for the current user
get.description: Retrieves the default payment method associated with the current user's account, including card details, validation status, and billing information.

get.summary: Get all payment methods for the current user
get.description: Retrieves all saved payment methods associated with the current user's account, including card details, validation status, and billing information.

delete.description: Permanently removes a saved payment method from the user's account. This action cannot be undone.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the payment method to remove

post.summary: Validates a payment method after 3D Secure authentication
post.description: Completes the validation process for a payment method that required 3D Secure authentication. This endpoint should be called after the user completes the 3D Secure challenge.

post.summary: Confirm a payment using a saved payment method
post.description: Processes a payment using a previously saved payment method. This endpoint handles wallet top-ups and may require 3D Secure authentication for certain payment methods or amounts.

202.description: 3D Secure authentication required to complete payment

get.summary: Get transaction history for the current customer

schema.description: ID of the last transaction from the previous page (if paginating forwards)
ID of the first transaction from the previous page (if paginating backwards)

get.summary: Export transaction history as CSV for the current customer

schema.description: Timezone for date formatting in the CSV

get.summary: Get historical data of billing and usage for a wallet address.

schema.description: The wallet address to get billing and usage data for
Start date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to 30 days before endDate
End date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to today by UTC 23:59:59

activeDeployments.description: Number of active deployments on this date

dailyAktSpent.description: AKT tokens spent on this date

totalAktSpent.description: Cumulative AKT tokens spent up to this date

totalUsdcSpent.description: Cumulative USDC spent up to this date

dailyUsdSpent.description: Total USD value spent on this date (AKT + USDC)

totalUsdSpent.description: Cumulative USD value spent up to this date

get.summary: Get historical usage stats for a wallet address.

schema.description: The wallet address to get billing and usage data for
Start date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to 30 days before endDate
End date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to today by UTC 23:59:59

averageSpentPerDay.description: Average spending per day in USD

averageDeploymentsPerDay.description: Average number of deployments deployed per day

get.summary: Retrieves an anonymous user by id

post.summary: Checks if the email is verified

get.summary: Get deployment settings by user ID and dseq

autoTopUpEnabled.description: Whether auto top-up is enabled for this deployment
Whether auto top-up is enabled for this deployment

get.summary: List deployments with pagination and filtering
Get a list of deployments by owner address.

200.description: Returns paginated list of deployments from database
Returns weekly cost for all deployments with auto top-up enabled

weeklyCost.description: Total weekly cost in USD for all deployments with auto top-up enabled

200.description: Returns paginated list of leases from database

schema.description: Optional wallet address to fetch balances for instead of the current user

parameters.description: Optional wallet address to fetch balances for instead of the current user
parameters.name: address

200.description: Returns a provider's active leases graph data

get.summary: Get a list of provider regions

200.description: Return a list of provider regions

get.summary: Get dashboard data for provider console.
Get earnings data for provider console.

200.description: List of providers grouped by version.

get.summary: Get a list of deployments for a provider.

post.summary: Create new JWT token for managed wallet

get.summary: Get a list of recent blocks.
Get the estimated date of a future block.
Get the estimated height of a future date and time.

post.summary: Estimate the price of a deployment on akash and other cloud providers.

requestBody.description: Deployment specs to use for the price estimation. **An array of specs can also be sent, in that case an array of estimations will be returned in the same order.**

cpu.description: CPU in thousandths of a core. 1000 = 1 core
CPU in thousandths of a core. 1000 = 1 core

200.description: Returns a list of deployment templates grouped by cateogories

cpu.description: CPU in thousandths of a core. 1000 = 1 core
CPU in thousandths of a core. 1000 = 1 core

get.summary: Get a list of gpu models and their availability.

200.description: List of gpu models and their availability.

400.description: Invalid provider parameter, should be a valid akash address or host uri

get.summary: Get a list of gpu models per vendor. Based on the content from https://raw.githubusercontent.com/akash-network/provider-configs/main/devices/pcie/gpus.json.
Gets gpu analytics breakdown by vendor and model. If no vendor or model is provided, all GPUs are returned.

200.description: Gets gpu analytics breakdown by vendor and model. If no vendor or model is provided, all GPUs are returned.

get.summary: Get a list of gpu models with their availability and pricing.

200.description: List of gpu models with their availability and pricing.
Returns a list of deployment templates grouped by categories
Returns a list of deployment templates grouped by categories
List of leases durations and total duration.

400.description: Invalid start date, must be in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD

get.summary: Get a list of transactions for a given address.
Get a list of nodes (api/rpc) for a specific network.

400.description: Validation error responded when some request parameters are invalid

401.description: Unauthorized error responded when the user is not authenticated

403.description: Forbidden error responded when the user is not authorized

500.description: Internal server error, should probably be reported
